paragraphs.text: “Don’t trust your memory. When you listen to something valuable, write it down. When you come across something important, write it down.” — Jim Rohn
paragraphs.name: d9a3
e31c
paragraphs.text: How do you expect to improve yourself if you don’t know yourself? You truly get to know the quality of your thoughts when you write them down.
“Today is the first day of my daily journaling habit.”
paragraphs.name: c3c7

paragraphs.text: I’ve been journaling about my fears for a long time now. And it truly helps. If you want to read more about that process, check out this article I wrote a while back.
paragraphs.name: c659

paragraphs.text: There’s this weird thing—when you write things down, they become real. Start journaling and see it for yourself.

virtuals.subtitle: A journal is the best self-awareness tool there is.

paragraphs.text: I’ve have started some kind of acticity log and you are totally right, that this improves myself. I will just get your book and read it while procrastinating often passes my way full of tasks.

Great post Darius. Journaling takes commitment and dedication but the results are so worthwhile. I set myself a 21-day challenge to get going and it’s stuck but months later there are still days when it feels more like a chore. I focus on the positive benefits to keep on track but it’s important to be flexible and adapt your style. There’s no one…

d3bd737c4677.title: A cool thing to keep a journal of is your dreams if you can remember them.

paragraphs.name: 3a8f
paragraphs.text: A cool thing to keep a journal of is your dreams if you can remember them. There’s a whole other world inside you when you sleep. If you wake up and jot some notes down, you’ll be surprised at how that jogs your memory when you write it out later. Who knows, maybe you’ll have a dream of the “next best thing”.

f27d08bc12cb.title: I used to keep a journal during the busiest part of my life, when kids were small and I was always…

paragraphs.name: e8cc
paragraphs.text: I used to keep a journal during the busiest part of my life, when kids were small and I was always working under pressure. Was so particular about writing, then. Now when I reflect, it is really surprising for me to believe how I must have managed to be so punctual, with all those responsibilities. I do not know actually when and how I gradually…

6fe3b93f574b.title: The easiest way to journal I’ve found, is to not think of journaling as journaling at all.

content.subtitle: Journaling is the one habit i am remarkably proud of. And all because of this one app that I once saw was being reviewed by The Verge.

paragraphs.name: ab00
paragraphs.text: The easiest way to journal I’ve found, is to not think of journaling as journaling at all. I use the Day One app on my phone, iPad and Mac as my personal hybrid Twitter. I open it up several times a day, jot down whatever it is I’m thinking — whether it’s three words or sentences or a personal essay, and then close the app. The most awesome thing…

content.subtitle: Essentially, I think it can be mitigated using one of three general approaches with varying degrees of complexity:

paragraphs.name: a8c8
paragraphs.text: Judy, this is a fair and valid concern and one that I’ve shared myself when considering taking up journaling. I’ve recently decided to take the plunge and embark upon the path blazed by Darius Foroux so I wanted to share my own thoughts on this topic in the hopes it might help convince others on the fence to take up journaling themselves.

39a3f0a99573.title: Just this one idea captured me already: “You truly get to know the quality of your thoughts when…

paragraphs.name: 1c06
paragraphs.text: Just this one idea captured me already: “You truly get to know the quality of your thoughts when you write them down.”.

paragraphs.name: a33d
paragraphs.text: Great article!

cb4ec85a9eba.title: Darius, the only thing that has kept me from keeping a journal in my life has been the fear that…

paragraphs.text: Darius, the only thing that has kept me from keeping a journal in my life has been the fear that someone else may read it. I have never wanted to record trauma, or to bring shame upon anyone I know. Stupid, I suppose. I’ve started over and over since I was a child, and everything went swimmingly until another trauma hit, and I stopped cold, not…

paragraphs.text: I would add: for 5–15 minutes a day, discipline yourself to journal. It is like exercise for your brain, so we ought to discipline ourselves with a routine.
